DOMTokenList.summary: The DOMTokenList interface represents a set of space-separated tokens. Such a set is returned by or , and many others.

remarks.para: A DOMTokenList is indexed beginning with 0 as with JavaScript objects. DOMTokenList is always case-sensitive.

DOMTokenListEntries.summary:
The entries() method of the interface
returns an allowing you
to go through all key/value pairs contained in this object. The values are
s which have [key, value] pairs, each representing a single token.

DOMTokenListAdd.summary: The add() method of the interface adds the given tokens to the list, omitting any that are already present.

DOMTokenListForEach.summary:
The forEach() method of the interface
calls the callback given in parameter once for each value pair in the list, in
insertion order.

DOMTokenListLength.summary:
The read-only length property of the interface is an integer representing the number
of objects stored in the object.
DOMTokenListLength.value: An positive integer, or 0 if the list is empty.

DOMTokenListRemove.summary:
The remove() method of the interface
removes the specified tokens from the list.

DOMTokenListToggle.summary:
The toggle() method of the interface
removes an existing token from the list and returns false.
If the token doesn't exist it's added and the function returns true.
DOMTokenListToggle.returns:
A boolean value, true or false, indicating whether token is in the
list after the call or not.

DOMTokenListValue.summary:
The value property of the
interface is a stringifier that returns the value of the list serialized as a
string, or clears and sets the list to the given value.
DOMTokenListValue.value:
A string representing the serialized content of the list.
Each item is separated by a space.

DOMTokenListSupports.summary:
The supports() method of the interface
returns true if a given token is in the associated attribute's supported tokens.
This method is intended to support feature detection.
DOMTokenListSupports.returns: A boolean value indicating whether the token was found.

DOMTokenListToString.summary: The toString() {{Glossary("stringifier")}} method of the interface returns the values of the token list serialized as a string. The return value is a space-separated list of tokens equal to the property.

DOMTokenListItem.summary:
The item() method of the interface returns an item in the list,
determined by its position in the list, its index.

blockquote.para:
This method is equivalent as the bracket notation.
So list.item(i) is the same as list[i].

DOMTokenListItem.returns:
A string representing the returned item,
or null if the number is greater than or equal to the length of the list.

DOMTokenListReplace.summary:
The replace() method of the interface
replaces an existing token with a new token.
If the first token doesn't exist, replace() returns false immediately,
without adding the new token to the token list.
DOMTokenListReplace.returns:
A boolean value, which is true if oldToken was
successfully replaced, or false if not.

DOMTokenListKeys.summary:
The keys() method of the interface
returns an {{jsxref("Iteration_protocols",'iterator',"",1)}} allowing to go through all keys contained in this object.
The keys are unsigned integers.

DOMTokenListValues.summary:
The values() method of the interface
returns an
allowing the caller to go through all values contained in the DOMTokenList.
The individual values are strings.

DOMTokenListContains.summary:
The contains() method of the interface
returns a boolean value â€” true if the underlying list contains the given token,
otherwise false.
DOMTokenListContains.returns:
A boolean value, which is true if the calling list contains
token, otherwise false.
